image.altText: Chenice Jordan

props.synopsis: Female participation in rugby league across the Canberra region has reached a record high. Despite this, both women's teams in Queanbeyan have been forced to fold mid-season due to a player shortage.

title.children: The footy club with a $600,000 female change room but no women's team

image.altText: A blonde woman in a blue blazer.

props.synopsis: Documents obtained by the ABC under a freedom of information request reveal that a complaint about Leanne Castley was formally lodged on June 25, though it was later withdrawn.

title.children: Complaint lodged then withdrawn against ACT Opposition Leader

image.altText: Three in scenery

props.synopsis: In the 41 years since the first Australians summitted Mount Everest, the mountain has been transformed into a tourist attraction. Does the original magic still exist? Â

title.children: The 'Australian Route' up Mt Everest that may never be repeated

image.altText: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.

props.synopsis: A prisoner has been sentenced to additional jail time, after admitting to biting off part of the ear of another inmate during a fight after a volleyball game.

title.children: Prisoner sentenced after biting off inmate's ear after volleyball game

image.altText: The exterior of a concrete court building.

props.synopsis: Details of a sophisticated drug distribution system run by a teenager emerge after she pleads guilty to charges including attempting to possess a marketable quantity of cocaine.

title.children: Teen's sophisticated drug distribution system revealed by her notes app

image.altText: Magpie thumbail

props.synopsis: A Canberra man has captured footage of the dramatic moment a magpie plucked his earphone from his ear.

props.synopsis: A Canberra squash club with half a century of history is slated for apartments, devastating club stalwarts.

title.children: 'Can't just discard us': Dick's beloved squash courts are set to be demolished

image.altText: An older woman and her daughter smiling in a close up photo

props.synopsis: Carers say a "broken sector" is letting down their loved ones with dementia, while a new study shows "confronting" diagnosis delays.

title.children: Some patients wait five years for diagnosis of 'Australia's biggest killer'

image.altText: A man sits on a tree stump and looks down

props.synopsis: A quiet town north-east of Ramallah, is on the front line of a territorial battle in the West Bank. It is playing out against the backdrop of international recognition of a Palestinian state.

title.children: A West Bank town symbolises the hurdles to Palestinian statehood

image.altText: A young man of colour with short black hair and a blue polo shirt looking out a window

props.synopsis: The government's expanded first home buyers' scheme was supposed to ensure they "get the keys quicker", but buyers, brokers and agents are warning of fierce competition.

title.children: First home buyers already 'out in force' following brand new scheme

image.altText: A computer sitting in a dark room by a lamp shows the Pornhub logo.

image.altText: A composite image of two boys, one in a white shirt and one in a collared shirt and dark puffer jacket.

props.synopsis: A court case into the alleged murder of an 18-year-old last year reveals a connection to the fatal attacks on Chol Achiek, 12, and Dau Akueng, 15, on September 6.Â

title.children: Boys' deaths in Melbourne's west allegedly linked to youth gang rivalry

image.altText: Photo of Gus

props.synopsis: A week of large-scale land and air searches have found no clues leading to the whereabouts of four-year-old Gus in outback South Australia.

title.children: Why the search for a missing 4yo in SA's outback was so challenging

image.altText: Early morning sun shining through steam clouds billowing from a nuclear power plant and transmissions lines.

props.synopsis:
As the federal Coalition looks to resurrect a nuclear policy, an energy analyst and a workers' union fear the impacts of parliament's inability to agree on Australia's energy future.

Â

title.children: O'Brien 'supremely confident' Liberal nuclear policy has a future

image.altText: Machester synagogue

props.synopsis: One of the victims of Thursday's attack at a synagogue in Manchester was shot by police during their attempts to bring the unarmed attacker under control.

title.children: Manchester attack victim reportedly killed by police bullet

image.altText: Workers' accommodation in Coral Bay that only exits in a central space.

props.synopsis:
A new housing report describes accommodation provided for some seasonal workers in Australia as dangerous, overpriced and overcrowded.

Â

title.children: Rodents, fire risks and overcrowding in seasonal worker housing: report

image.altText: Two men look on during a rugby league training session

props.synopsis: Not many players can be like Cameron Munster and Reece Walsh except for one another, and that's why they hold the fate of the 2025 NRL grand final in their hands.

title.children: The ties that bind Munster and Walsh ahead of NRL grand final showdown

image.altText: A part of blue ocean has exploded after a US bomb hit a boat riding in it.

props.synopsis: Without providing evidence, Pete Hegseth says the intelligence "without a doubt" confirms that the vessel was carrying drugs and that the people on board were "narco-terrorists".

title.children: US carries out new strike against alleged drug boat near Venezuela

props.synopsis: The Israeli military has intercepted and boarded the Marinette on Friday, believed to be the last ship still sailing to Gaza as part of the Global Sumud Flotilla.

title.children: Israeli military intercepts last flotilla boat sailing to Gaza

image.altText: Taylor Swift in a provocative outfit of jewels with red lipstick and finger in mouth.

title.children: A track-by-track look at Taylor Swift's The Life of a Showgirl

props.synopsis: Sarah Mullally becomes the female leader of one of last areas of British public life to have been led by men.

title.children: First woman appointed leader of Church of England

image.altText: The grand front entrance, featuring red timber doors and stone, to the Savage Club in Melbourne

props.synopsis: These clubs, which still exist right around the country, are the weirdest anomaly. They sit jostled up against the Australia they firmly shut their doors against; their purpose in modern Australia seems almost neurotic.

title.children: A men's club so exclusive it almost blew up over the prospect of female guests

image.altText: A woman speaks into a mobile phone looking anguished as tears roll down her face

props.synopsis: As recovery efforts continue, some parents have argued with emergency services, demanding they speed up their work so they can bury their loved ones.

title.children: At least 13 people killed in Indonesian school collapse disaster

image.altText: Woman smiles next to white bichon poodle holding to flight tickets

props.synopsis: Brisbane woman Lisa Robinson made a discrimination complaint following the incident, and the airline has implemented changes to its policy following a two-year review.

title.children: Settlement reached after woman not allowed to fly with assistance dog

image.altText: a map of Victoria with Melbourne, Falls Creek, and Nelse listed on it.

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed they have located two women dead at Nelse, near Falls Creek in Victoria's alpine area.Â

title.children: Two women found dead near remote Victorian alpine hut

image.altText: Marine scientist Mike Steer.

props.synopsis: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

title.children: SA's algal bloom chief keen to hit the beach this summer

image.altText: an aerial view of tents for displaced people and refugees in syria

props.synopsis: A small group of Australian women who travelled or were taken to Syria as partners of Islamic State members, as well as their children, have managed to smuggle themselves out of the country and have now returned home, after years of being stranded overseas.

title.children: Women and children stranded in Syria return to Australia after smuggling themselves from country

image.altText: A yellow sign that reads "for your privacy no photography, no audio recording, no video recording".

title.children: MDMA, ketamine and cocaine: What the NSW pill testing trial has uncovered

image.altText: A woman in a blue swimming cap holds the pool wall and smiles after a race.

props.synopsis: Research by Federation University has found 63 per cent of girls have missed training, and a third have missed competitions, because of period-related challenges in athletics and swimming.

title.children: Period-related challenges may contribute to teen girls dropping sport

image.altText: Close up of a man dressed in a white shirt and black suit jacket.

props.synopsis: The man tasked with reviewing WA's "old and depleted" hospitals says building a brand new one will not fix a snowballing health crisis.

title.children: New WA hospital not silver bullet to fix ramping crisis, warns former health boss

image.altText: A woman holds a framed photo of a man in white uniform flanked by two other women

props.synopsis: Lim Kimya was gunned down shortly after arriving in Bangkok earlier this year by Ekkalak Paenoi, but his widow is questioning who is behind her husband's death.

title.children: Widow of murdered ex-MP wants to know who 'ordered' his killing

image.altText: a young girl wearing a headset types into an electronic tablet computer while a young boy watches on.

props.synopsis: A new project is collecting thousands of messages destined for the cosmos, coinciding with the anniversary of a landmark space mission 50 years ago.Â

title.children: Sydneysiders record thousands of messages to be sent to deep space

Advocates say an outdated funding model and cost shifting has left Queensland councils in a risky financial position, with nowhere left to turn for cash except ratepayers.

title.children: 'Unsustainable' councils pass on financial pressure to ratepayers

image.altText: A picture of white off the ground apartments

props.synopsis: The NT Supreme Court is set to hand down a ruling on whether a major community housing provider is exempt from paying council rates in Palmerston. It's a case which may set a territory-wide precedent, reshape council budgets and force them to slash services or hike rates.

title.children: This NT Supreme Court case may trigger a rates rise for territory home owners

image.altText: Oscar Piastri speaks to a teammate behind the scenes at the Singapore GP.

props.synopsis: Australian Oscar Piastri quickly bounces back from his Baku nightmare to set the fastest time on the first day of practice at the Singapore Grand Prix.

title.children: Piastri bounces back from Baku disaster with sizzling practice run in Singapore
